poem:
**Embassy Closed, Dublin**

A sea divides,  
Edges sharp as whispers  
in quiet rooms—  
maps unroll,   
fingers trace lines  
under clouds heavy  
with unspoken names.  
  
Wind breathes cities apart;  
Dublin's streets weave  
tales of distance,  
unheard by domes  
where silence weighs  
upon unseen hands,  
as doors shut quietly  
on all but echoes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel to close embassy in Dublin over ‘anti-Israel policies’ after Ireland’s backing of genocide petition – as it happened 3.46pm GMT Closing summary Israel has announced it will close its embassy in Ireland, citing Dublin’s decision last week to support a petition at the international court of justice accusing Israel of “genocide”. The move was announced by Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, who said it was prompted by the Irish government’s “extreme anti-Israeli policies”, noting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
